subject: Re: Quickscript in other countries
msgSnippet: Arabic is written with almost only consonants. And it s true that there re heck lot of illogic words, but not as much as in English. By the way; I didn t said
messageBody:
Arabic is written with almost only consonants. And it's true that
there're heck lot of illogic words, but not as much as in English. By
the way; I didn't said that all words are written as they're pronounced.

--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, Jerry <nieuwsgroep222@...> wrote:
>
> ramsesoudt wrote:
>
> > <snip> In Dutch most words are said as they're written, but it
> > contains a lot of unnecessary letters.
> >
>
>
>
> Is that really true? Mind the 'e's in "geschreven". Are they the same
> vocals? I think some languages like Arabic are more consistent in
> spelling. Although Dutch isn't as bad as French :-)
>
